questions.question_text: Which is a purpose of a quality register?

choices.D: To identify corrective actions that are required after an audit by quality assurance
choices.A: To record the quality management approach for a product
choices.C: To detail the number and type of quality activities to be conducted
choices.B: To issue a unique reference number for each product

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A.23.1: A quality register is used to summarize all the quality management activities that are planned or have taken place, and provides information for the end stage reports and end project report. Its purpose is to act as a summary of the number and type of quality activities undertaken.

Selected Answer: C
A quality register is a document or system that captures and documents information about the quality management activities that are carried out during a project. The purpose of a quality register is to ensure that quality activities are planned, tracked, and reported in a consistent and transparent manner.
Out of the given options, option C, "To detail the number and type of quality activities to be conducted," is the correct answer.

Selected Answer: C
Correction: it is C: The Quality Register
The Quality Register is a diary of the Quality events that take place during the project, such as workshops, reviews, testing and acceptance. At first, the Quality Register will be empty and the Project Manager will get most data from the plans and Product Descriptions. Many Project Managers will use a spreadsheet for a Quality Register.

Selected Answer: A
Should be A: per PRINCE2 wiki;

Product Description must include the Quality criteria information so that all project stakeholders have a common understanding of the products that will be created.

For example, if you are creating a new can opener, some of the quality criteria might be:

Stainless steel and plastic handle should keep their color for 20 years.
Dishwasher-proof.
Mechanical parts must open 35,000 cans.
Easy to use.
As you can see, the Quality criteria gives a lot more detail about the product.
option C is correct
C is correct . 2.1one characteristic of project work that distinguish it from business as usual:Cross-functional: A project involves a team of people with different skills working together

c is correct - cross functional
d is incorrect - benefits of PRINCE2

Selected Answer: C
c is correct

Selected Answer: C
c is the right answer

Selected Answer: C
it is Cross-functional

Selected Answer: C
C Stands out for me also.
C is correct
Question should read "Which describes a characteristic of a Prince 2 project?". Otherwise option C is also correct.
Option C refers to "Team", which is not the main idea of a project.
option C definitely is correct.
Option C

questions.question_text: Which describes a characteristic of a project?

choices.C: It involves a team with different skills
choices.D: It enables established and proven best practices
choices.A: It maintains business as usual profitability
choices.B: It provides a quality service to customers

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
A. Approving the completion of each management stage: board
B. Ensuring that the project produces the required products: PM
C. Defining the project-level tolerances: corporate or programme mgmt
D. Verifying that the project gives value for money: board (executive)

questions.question_text: What is the project manager role responsible for?

choices.A: Approving the completion of each management stage
choices.D: Verifying that the project gives value for money
choices.B: Ensuring that the project produces the required products

discussion.content: The Progress theme provides all management levels within the project management team with mechanisms for monitoring and control by establishing tolerances, progress reporting, exception management, and change control.

Selected Answer: A
Option A is correct. "with mechanisms for monitoring and control"...

questions.question_text: Which theme provides all management levels within the project management team with mechanisms for monitoring and control?

discussion.content: Option D seems to be correct
D - Project Brief is correct
I concur with D
I agree, Project brief describes about the scope of the project.
According to A.19.2 of Prince 2 project brief provides project definition which constrains of: project scope and exclusions, contraints and assumptions.
D Seems to be correct
Should be D
Initiation stage plan, not defining scope but plan activity during initiation stage and provide project board with elaborate outlined business case in project brief. It should be D
